intro: Cardamine urbaniana, commonly known as the urban buttercup, is a small herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as urban cracks, garden soils, and woodland edges. It features delicate, heart-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Due to its adaptability, it is often found in disturbed or cultivated areas.
